text: That's Where It's At! is an album by blues musician John Lee Hooker recorded in 1961 collecting five tracks originally released on a split album by Guest Star Records in 1966 along with five unreleased tracks, that was issued by the Stax label in 1969. ==Reception== AllMusic reviewer Richie Unterberger stated: "A characteristic solo outing with moody compositions and that doomy one- electric-guitar-and-stomping-foot ambience, That's Where It's At! is one of Hooker's sparer and more menacing post-'50s outings". ==Track listing== All compositions credited to John Lee Hooker # "Teachin' the Blues" – 3:24 # "Goin' to Louisiana" – 4:40 # "I Need You" – 2:56 # "My Love Comes Down for You" – 3:27 # "Please Don't Go" – 2:47 # "I Just Don't Know" – 3:46 # "Slow and Easy" – 3:07 # "Two White Horses" – 3:55 # "Feel So Bad" – 7:47 # "Grinder Man" – 3:54 ==Personnel== *John Lee Hooker – guitar, vocals ==References== Category:John Lee Hooker albums Category:1969 albums Category:Stax Records albums
title: That's Where It's At!
